btw, this isn’t a help section.
[/quote]
Actually, this section is for anything programming-related that isn’t private-server related (and thus covered by other forum sections).
Which means people are more than welcome to ask questions here. Mind you, that doesn’t mean we’re going to do your homework for you – but questions in general are okay.[/quote]

Oh okay, thanks for clearing it up.

LilXCj:

Don’t refer to RuneScape Private Server JAVA programming. It’s not effecient enough. It’s much easier to learn JAVA, then apply those skills to RuneScape Private Servers. When you look at tutorials for RuneScape Private Servers. You start learning how to apply those skills only to Private Servers and it takes forever to try and apply it to something else because you don’t know how.

Well said -.-, people do not want to learn java though, they just want to code their server and have fun :P… But i get your point and its true

Well said, but s

item.title: [Java] Linking two files
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:22, topic:341535”][quote author=sp11k3t3ht3rd link=topic=437933.msg3219083#msg3219083 date=1275006097]
Thanks! At least some people on these forums aren’t jerks.
[/quote]

Only a few people aren’t jerks on the forums.

btw, this isn’t a help section.

Packaged means its in a lot of different files/folders.

Unpackaged = Deltascape, all in one file/folder

To call from another class just add the class name before it.

Mining(theclass).mineThis(themethod).objectClicking(in the current class)

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

This tutorial shows how to basically call things from another class.[/quote]

Packaging is adding classes to packages that contain classes of the same relevance.

item.title: [Java] Linking two files
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“PeeHPee, post:18, topic:341535”][quote author=sp11k3t3ht3rd link=topic=437933.msg3218900#msg3218900 date=1274996208]

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        test method = new test();
        method.test(args);
    }
}
public class test {
    public void test (String[] args) {
        int testInt1;
        int testInt2;
        testInt1 = 2;
        testInt2 = testInt1 + 6;
        System.out.println("The number is: " +testInt2);
    }
}

Oh really? because I don’t have import java.io.*; at the top and it runs fine…
[/quote]

That means ur jdk is glitched u should install the newer version[/quote]

Lol PeeHPee Is A Good Coder So He Knows His Shit…

Go Install The Newest Jdk Noob… Ffs…

Read full topic

public class test { public void test (String[] args) { int testInt1; int testInt2; testInt1 = 2; testInt2 = testInt1 + 6; System.out.println("The number is: " +testInt2); } } [/quote]

Oh really? because I don’t have import java.io.*; at the top and it runs fine…

item.title: [Java] Linking two files
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:10, topic:341535”]Would you all get a clue before replying? The test class clearly isn’t part of a package so why over-complicate the situation?

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        test method = new test();
        method.test(args);
    }
}

public class test { public void test (String[] args) { int testInt1; int testInt2; testInt1 = 2; testInt2 = testInt1 + 6; System.out.println("The number is: " +testInt2); } } [/quote]

Its to late to do this shit. Am I making any sense right now, because I am going to get into my bed. Night

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Linking two files
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:10, topic:341535”]Would you all get a clue before replying? The test class clearly isn’t part of a package so why over-complicate the situation?

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        test method = new test();
        method.test(args);
    }
}

public class test { public void test (String[] args) { int testInt1; int testInt2; testInt1 = 2; testInt2 = testInt1 + 6; System.out.println("The number is: " +testInt2); } } [/quote]

Thank you Lothy!!!

import java.io.*; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { test method = new test(); } }
That code would compile but wouldn’t print anything out, but yours did Lothy thanks a ton!

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Linking two files
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Would you all get a clue before replying? The test class clearly isn’t part of a package so why over-complicate the situation?

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        test method = new test();
        method.test(args);
    }
}
public class test {
    public void test (String[] args) {
        int testInt1;
        int testInt2;
        testInt1 = 2;
        testInt2 = testInt1 + 6;
        System.out.println("The number is: " +testInt2);
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Linking two files
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

If your files are in the same folder then you don’t need to add package test; or import test;. But you will need to add import java.io.*; to the Main class. I suggest you read how to package if your going to package this little testing.

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Linking two files
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:7, topic:341535”]When you package a server you don’t type import test; as the package name, you use package name;.
EX: package src.org.game;

For the import you will need some thing like this.

import src.org.game.*; or import src.org.game.Test;

EDIT: I haven’t packaged for a while so I was wrong the first time.

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/deployment/jar/index.html[/quote]

so at the top of main.java i should put:

package test;

?

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Linking two files
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

When you package a server you don’t type import test; as the package name, you use package name;.
EX: package src.org.game;

For the import you will need some thing like this.

import src.org.game.*; or import src.org.game.Test;

EDIT: I haven’t packaged for a while so I was wrong the first time.

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/deployment/jar/index.html

Read full topic
